description.narrative: By end 2021, the operationalization of an intersectoral strategy and action plan for All Girls in School, has significantly contributed to a more conducive policy environment, mobilization of civil society, increased girls' enrolment, learning and retention and decreased drop-out rates of girls at every age.

sector.narrative: Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Afghanistan: Mid-term evaluation of the increasing access to basic education and gender equality programme
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, the operationalization of an intersectoral strategy and action plan for All Girls in School, has significantly contributed to a more conducive policy environment, mobilization of civil society, increased girls’ enrolment, learning and retention and decreased drop-out rates of girls at every age.

description.narrative: UNICEF's continued support resulted in finalization of Girls' Education Strategy endorsement by the Ministry of Education. By June 2020, 66,751 (29,618 male/37,133 female) (38.8 per cent) adolescents and young adults were empowered as actors of change through civic engagement and social mobilization to challenge norms related to child marriage and access to education. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/07/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of trained school management shura members promoting positive behaviour and attitudes towards girls' education
System Strengthening - Gender - National education sector plan/policies support gender-responsive environments - score (1-4), see guidance

Service Delivery - Number of children/adolescents studying primary education through alternative modes of delivery (formal or non formal, e.g. evening school, weekend school, distance learning) with support from UNICEF
